channel.title: Automatic gun laws
channel.description: Would it be legal to own a Fully auto ak-47, with no firing pin assembly? so basically just a nice looking weapon that doesn't work, cant shoot at all.

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

Go read these and yes it is illegal to have an fully automatic gun in the USA.

en.wikipedia.org

Federal Assault Weapons Ban

The Federal Assault Weapons Ban (AWB), officially the Public Safety and Recreational Firearms Use Protection Act, is a subsection of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994, a United States federal law, which included a prohibition on the manufacture for civilian use of certain semi-automatic firearms that were defined as assault weapons as well as certain ammunition magazines that were defined as "large capacity." The 10-year ban was passed by the US Congress on September 13...

Ps: The reason I know that a fully automatic gun is illegal in the USA is because my dad used to be in the army and he used to be a gun mechanic while in the army.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:9, topic:201998”]

That’s a heavy machine gun, commonly referred to as a machine gun…

That’s a submachine gun, or assault rifle.

Learn the difference.[/quote]

Its an assault rifle… an sub machine gun is a totally different weapon

a sub machine gun is a weapon thats small and uses bullets that are made for close quarter combat where as an assault rifle is a weapon that is build combining the accuracy of a rifle and range of a rifle with the firepower of a smg

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:24, topic:201998”]You are allowed to own a semi-automatic AK-47 (or any gun) in the USA, so all you need to do if you really feel the need for a fully automatic one is:

  1. Get a kit to put a hidden switch on it to go from semi to full auto.
  2. (this is what I would do for my SKS) Buy another trigger assembly, file down the sear to the point where it is fully automatic, and just leave the original semi-auto trigger assembly in there until you have a need to swap them out. Trigger assemblies by themselves are never illegal. :)[/quote]The ol’ redneck always knows.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You are allowed to own a semi-automatic AK-47 (or any gun) in the USA, so all you need to do if you really feel the need for a fully automatic one is:

  1. Get a kit to put a hidden switch on it to go from semi to full auto.
  2. (this is what I would do for my SKS) Buy another trigger assembly, file down the sear to the point where it is fully automatic, and just leave the original semi-auto trigger assembly in there until you have a need to swap them out. Trigger assemblies by themselves are never illegal.

Read full topic

An assault rifle is a machine gun, you twat.
[/quote]

An assault rifle is a class of machine guns[/quote]

Thankyou. Now realise why this means you can’t call someone out for saying an assault rifle is a machine gun. Just because you and the boys down the gun club or whatever don’t accept this definition dosen’t make it any less true.

By the way, an SMGs fire pistol rounds, by definition. The AK dosen’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

A submachine gun is generally characterized by a stock, a pistol grip, a large capacity mag, and fully automatic fire. Let’s see… oh wait, that describes the AK.

Errm, no. A submachinegun is characterized by the mag of an assault rifle and the shape and size of a pistol…

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Mopman:

An assault rifle is a machine gun, you twat.

An assault rifle is a class of machine guns, but the term machine guns used without reference is generally taken to mean a heavy/mounted machine gun.

[quote=“Mopman, post:13, topic:201998”]And a fully automatic weapon is a machine gun. Whether you can hold and fire it at the same time makes no difference.

Call it a “light machine gun” if you want to be pedantic, but a machine gun it is.[/quote]

Light machine guns are generally portable machine guns, usually used with a bipod for support. You cannot use an AK in the same situation you would use a LMG. An AK-47 is an assault rifle, for closer range encounters with infantry. An LMG is a support weapon; hip firing with one is lol-worthy.

Mopman:

I wasn’t trying to piss you off man, just stopping legit from claiming another victim

By trying to convince everyone that I’m wrong when I’m actually right.

ninja nub:

I hate it when legit does that… God damn his Wikipedia embedded mind!

Wikipedia embedded? Where the hell do you get that idea?

io9:

ninja nub: xxlegitxx is a twat…

This is after asking me for rep so you can become CM.

[quote=“io9, post:17, topic:201998”]
THAT’S a submachinegun.

YOU learn the difference…[/quote]

A submachine gun is generally characterized by a stock, a pistol grip, a large capacity mag, and fully automatic fire. Let’s see… oh wait, that describes the AK.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic gun laws
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“ninja nub, post:12, topic:201998”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=266657.msg2204329#msg2204329 date=1209102372]
An assault rifle is a machine gun, you twat.
[/quote]

No it is not. An M16 is not a machine gun, it is an automatic rifle. An Ak-47 is not a machine gun, it is an automatic rifle! OI OI OI![/quote]

And a fully automatic weapon is a machine gun. Whether you can hold and fire it at the same time makes no difference.

Call it a “light machine gun” if you want to be pedantic, but a machine gun it is.
